New Records: Shohei Ohtani became the first player in MLB history to hit 50 home runs and steal 50 bases in a single season during the Miami Marlins vs Los Angeles Dodgers game on 2024-09-20.
Key Match Events: The Dodgers defeated the Miami Marlins 20-4, clinching their 12th consecutive playoff berth.
Shohei Ohtani hit his 50th home run in the 7th inning with a line drive to left-center field.
Post-Match Reflections: Max Muncy expressed awe at Ohtani's performance, noting his ability to handle pressure and deliver in crucial moments.
Mookie Betts laughed and marveled at Ohtani's historic achievement, calling it 'amazing'.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Ohtani's season was highlighted by his offensive prowess and resilience despite facing significant challenges.
The Dodgers' playoff chances were significantly boosted by Ohtani's contributions.
